lead_paragraph: The Military Affairs Committee of the Senate will begin hearings today on the most important bill that has been brought before the new Congress since it convened two months ago. This is the National War Service Bill, which would impose upon every able-bodied man and woman in the United States the legal obligation "to render such personal service in aid of the war effort as he or she may be deemed best fitted to perform."
